sentence.Network_en: The receipt shall specify the date of presentment for acceptance and shall be signed.
sentence.Network_cn: 回单上应当记明汇票提示承兑日期并签章.

sentence.Network_en: The countermand of a cheque only takes effect after the expiration oflimit of time for presentment.
sentence.Network_cn: 撤销支票付款的委托,仅于提示期限满后行之,始为有效.

sentence.Network_en: When the cause of delay ceases to operate , presentment must be made with reasonable diligence.
sentence.Network_cn: 但一待导致延迟之原因终止, 即须尽合理努力作付款提示.

derivation.yuyuan_name: Middle English: from Old French presentement, from presenter 'place before' (see present)

means.word_mean: 1. an accusation of crime made by a grand jury on its own initiative
2. a document that must be accepted and paid by another person
3. a show or display; the act of presenting something to sight or view;
